index.summary: I'm a designer by nature with a background in technology and startups. I've previously lived in Chicago, New York, Miami, Beijing, Montreal, and Vancouver. I enjoy learning, creating things, thinking about experiences, studying education and psychology, road trips, and biking.

education.title: Additional Education
education.description: 6 MOOCs completed from John Hopkins University, University of Toronto, University of Virginia, Stanford University / Lynda member, recipient two-year Treehouse Gold scholarship / design books, workshops at AIGA, Tekserve, Noble Desktop, General Assembly, etc.

education.title: University of Florida
education.institution: Digital Arts & Sciences, College of Engineering (dropped out)
education.description: 1st place team at IDEO JumpstART V, finalist for The HackerHouse startup incubator, volunteer organizer at TEDxUF, volunteer at 3DayStartup and Startup Weekend Gainesville, member of TEC, Software Development Club, Gators for Green Design, The Wildlife Society, and TED Club

education.title: Neuqua Valley High School
education.description: ACT 35, AP Scholar w/ Distinction, National Merit Semifinalist, Illinois Innovation Talent, State Finalist in BPA, 1st place regional in WYSE, ΔΕΦ German Honor Society, Environmental Club

education.title: Northwestern University CTD
education.description: Collaborated with groups of students from around the country, conducted research and field study, earned an A

work.title: Mobile Interface Design Intern
work.description: Led UX and UI for a complete redesign of Hejia's mobile ERP client, working with iOS and Android developers to implement on both platforms

work.title: Project Breaker
work.description: Based out of AOL Ventures offices, worked in small groups to research, prototype, and test ideas, learned how to rapidly iterate on ideas and get real world feedback to improve civic engagement in NYC, advised by designers at Qlabs, Google Creative Lab, IDEO, frog design

work.title: Co-Founder
work.description: Conducted customer validation, user research, created prototypes and interface for the web app, won a $2000 seed grant from IMSA

work.title: Design Helper
work.description: Helped conduct market research, interviewed users, and created product roadmap, launched at TechWeek 2011

work.title: Pilot Tester
work.description: Helped with Chrome OS testing and feature suggestions prior to release, received Cr-48 prototype laptop

work.title: Business Development Intern
work.description: Assisted with business development and designing web presence for new startup incubator branch of a marketing firm

work.title: Researcher
work.description: Audited school facilities energy usage and designed plan to reduce computer idle time (IT department accepted plan and helped with implementing), saving school $4,100 a year in electricity

other.title: Volunteer Lab Coordinator
other.description: As Lab Coordinator, I served as liaison between CIW and labs hosted by Accenture ACIN Lab, DraftFCB's Digital/UX, Northwestern University Knight Lab, and Navy Pier

other.title: Volunteer Instructor
other.description: While living in New York City, I volunteered to help adults learn to bike (using an awesome method pioneered by Bike NY)

awards: 1st place, IDEO JumpstART V with Duane Bray
Best Product Demo, Startup Weekend Chicago
2nd place, IMSA Power Pitch at MIT Enterprise Forum
Youngest winner of 'DEMOgod' at DEMO Spring 2012
Selected by Twilio and SendGrid for all-expenses paid trip
Once had a conference call with President Obama
fun: Featured on VentureBeat, Computerworld, Crain’s Business, Chicago Tribune, Sun-Times Media, GOOD, TechCrunch
